description:
Gosu is a new JVM-based programming language being released by Guidewire Software. It is a practical, imperative, object oriented language that includes many features: closures, support for composition, and extensions to existing classes, to name a few. It also has an API for introducing new kinds of types called the Open Type System, which allows new resources to be plugged into the compiler without modifying the underlying language or compiler.

This talk will give a quick overview of the language and the Open Type System as a sneak peek before it is officially introduced by Scott McKinney at the JVM Language Summit the following week.
title: A Sneak Peek at Gosu
